clinical_study.brief_title: Using a Cold Atmospheric Plasma Device to Treat Skin Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: Using a Cold Atmospheric Plasma Device to Treat Skin Disorders

brief_summary.textblock: This study examines the efficacy of a non-thermal, atmospheric plasma device in the treatment of skin disorders

detailed_description.textblock: The study uses non-thermal atmospheric pressure plasma to treat target conditions. The patients are monitored at set intervals for efficacy and adverse effects using investigator's assessment and imaging techniques

primary_outcome.description: The outcome is the presence or lack of clinical improvement in the investigator's global assessment and reviewing photo-documentation as well as reflectance confocal microscopy study investigator's global assessment and reviewing photo-documentation

arm_group.description: A compound of non-thermal atmospheric plasma and medium is used to treat the target by direct application or by on-site generation of the compound

intervention.intervention_name: Non-thermal, atmospheric plasma to treat skin lesions and acne
intervention.description: Non-thermal, atmospheric plasma treatment of affected area or lesions using a nanosecond dielectric barrier discharge plasma device

intervention.intervention_name: Indirect non-thermal, atmospheric plasma to treat hair loss and acne
intervention.description: A compound of non-thermal, atmospheric plasma and medium is delivered to or generated at the target area. Plasma is generated using either microsecond dielectric barrier discharge plasma device or PiezoBrush (a helium jet plasma). The medium is an aqueous alcohol solution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnoses of target conditions
- ability to complete study protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- based on specific condition
